overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a practical approach to time-series forecasting with limited data and anomalies. It focuses on identifying daily seasonality while addressing a significant anomaly in the input data. The solution prioritizes simplicity and robustness by excluding anomalous periods and using hourly averaging of valid days, then repeating the pattern for the forecast horizon.
key_insights: Exclusion of anomalous days (e.g., constant-value periods) to prevent skewing forecasts
Hourly averaging of valid historical days to capture daily patterns
Pattern repetition for multi-day forecasts when weekly seasonality cannot be modeled
Data segmentation by day/hour indices for precise pattern extraction
Rounding conventions matching input data precision
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with emphasis on data quality assessment and pattern-based heuristics. Balances statistical reasoning (seasonality identification) with practical simplifications due to data limitations, avoiding advanced modeling.
